definition: to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
confused/dizzy/giddy/to faint/to swoon/to lose consciousness/to pass out

sentences.english: Two hours later, Mr Wu woke up feeling groggy and uneasy.
sentences.chinese: 两个小时后，伍醒了，感到脑袋发晕且很不舒服。

sentences.english: My blood froze and I felt weak and faint.
sentences.chinese: 我吓得浑身冰凉，感到身子虚弱，头脑发晕。

sentences.english: He felt faint at the sight of blood.
In this from the equator very near the sun and flower lets a person feel dizzy.
sentences.chinese: 在这离赤道很近的地方阳光和鲜花一样让人发晕。

sentences.english: My head began to spin after three glasses of wine.
sentences.chinese: 三杯酒落肚，我的头开始发晕了。

sentences.english: His muse pullulated with dizzying speed.
sentences.chinese: 他的灵感以令人发晕的速度滋长着。

sentences.english: She has acrophobia and always becomes dizzy in a high-rise elevator.
sentences.chinese: 她有恐高症，到了高楼的电梯里就发晕。

definition: to faint with blurred vision (idiom); dizzy and eyes dimmed
to feel dizzy/to be confused/to be at a loss/to stare blankly/Taiwan pr. [fa1 meng2]
swelling of the head (physical condition)/fig. swellheaded/conceited
to ache/to be sore/to feel painful
to faint with blurred vision (idiom); dizzy and eyes dimmed
the sky spins, the earth goes round (idiom); giddy with one's head spinning/fig. huge changes in the world
variant of 頭昏腦脹|头昏脑胀[tou2 hun1 nao3 zhang4]
variant of 頭暈腦脹|头晕脑胀[tou2 yun1 nao3 zhang4]
